cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 520 mi (835 km) E of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting southwest just east of the northern Leeward Islands, then forecast to turn west and northwest Sunday–Tuesday and remain over the open Atlantic east of Puerto Rico–Virgin Islands before accelerating north‐northwest
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall currently projected; center expected to remain east of the Leeward Islands and Virgin Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coasts of the northern Leeward Islands, the U.S. and British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico will experience hazardous swells and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Tropical‐storm force winds are unlikely at St. Croix (≤ 3 % cumulative probability for 34 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; system stays well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered heavy showers possible late weekend into early next week but totals currently forecast below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long‐period swells producing dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend and persisting into early next week.
